f7c95b05-262d-4b86-ba57-092191920bbb.description: A CPTD has direct experience in the field of talent development. CPTDs understand, and can affect, the value and impact employee learning & development strategies bring to the success of an organization. A CPTD can develop, implement, and evaluate solutions that impact an organization’s ability to achieve its goals and drive competitive advantage. The key capabilities for a CPTD are defined in the Talent Development Capability Model and include key personal, professional & organizational skills.
f7c95b05-262d-4b86-ba57-092191920bbb.name: Certified Professional in Talent Development

badge_template_activities.title: Document at least five years’ professional experience working with adults, performing talent development activities as described in the Developing Professional Capability and/or Impacting Organizational Capability domains of the Talent Development Capability Model. This includes activities such as instructional design, training delivery and facilitation, learning technologies, evaluating learning programs, human performance improvement.

Pass a comprehensive, standardized exam designed to assess the ability to apply knowledge and use critical thinking to solve on-the-job situations encountered in the daily work of talent development professionals. The 150 question exam includes multiple choice questions and case management questions with extensive branching to validate the ability to apply previous learning and experience to future circumstances.
Adhere to a Code of Ethics and re-certify every three (3) years through at least 60 points of continuing professional development.

As part of the application process, candidates must document a minimum of sixty (60) hours of continuing education coursework completed that covers core talent development capability areas, as described in the Talent Development Capability Model. This includes: learning sciences, instructional design, training delivery & facilitation, change management, knowledge management, talent strategy & management, business insight

43b57381-fe22-426a-83e8-1e830ef9b49c.description: An Association for Talent Development (ATD) Master Trainer™ has elevated skills in engaging learners through impactful facilitation, building consultative partnerships, adapting to the unforeseen, managing in the moment, and championing a learner-centered design. An ATD Master Trainer™ can walk into any learning program, in any modality, and demonstrate advanced training delivery and facilitation to achieve learning outcomes.
43b57381-fe22-426a-83e8-1e830ef9b49c.name: Association for Talent Development (ATD) Master Trainer™

badge_template_activities.title: An ATD Master Trainer™ is expected to have a minimum 3 years experience before attending the ATD Master Trainer™ Program.
ATD Master Trainer™ Program participants are expected to have at least one previous training or education experience in the field of training delivery & facilitation.

An ATD Master Trainer™ is required to submit a final learning project which is a video submission of their training skills as well as a video analysis of their submission. This assignment is reviewed and scored against a rubric by an ATD Facilitator.

8e25c453-a662-42f7-bba5-c2a39da4ec64.description: An ATD Master Instructional Designer™ has elevated skills in partnering with stakeholders to identify and define skills gaps—employing a variety of effective design approaches based on learning sciences—and proficiency with many technologies. An ATD Master Instructional Designer™ can easily pivot between designing for multiple modalities and can implement the learning solutions via multiple media streams to produce learner-centered events.
8e25c453-a662-42f7-bba5-c2a39da4ec64.name: Association for Talent Development (ATD) Master Instructional Designer™

badge_template_activities.title: The ATD Master Instructional Designer™ Program covers the entire process of analysis, design, development, implementation, and evaluation of learning programs across all modalities (face-to-face, e-learning, virtual, or a blend). Explore new design models and techniques, evaluate real-world projects, and work with expert facilitators in this eight week online program.
An ATD Master Instructional Designer™ is expected to have a minimum of three years’ experience before attending the ATD Master Instructional Designer™ Program.

ATD Master Instructional Designer™ Program participants are expected to have a strong background in traditional instructional design tasks and at least one previous training or education experience in the field of instructional design.

An ATD Master Instructional Designer™ is required to submit a real-work project in four parts that demonstrates instructional design abilities. This project is reviewed and scored against a rubric by an ATD facilitator.

cfb3cd2d-7c2c-4ac8-96d4-f7571a141864.description: An APTD has early career experience and understands that well-designed talent development strategies and solutions contribute to organizational success. APTDs can affect the development, implementation, and evaluation of learning solutions that impact an organization’s ability to achieve its goals and drive competitive advantage. The foundational knowledge of an APTD is defined in the Talent Development Capability Model and includes key personal, professional & organizational knowledge areas.
cfb3cd2d-7c2c-4ac8-96d4-f7571a141864.name: Associate Professional in Talent Development

badge_template_activities.title: Document at least three years’ experience in the talent development field or related fields/disciplines, such as human resources, higher education, or similar. Candidates must also document at least 28 hours of professional development in talent development content tied to the Developing Professional Capability and/or Impacting Organizational Capability of the Talent Development Capability Model.
Pass a comprehensive, standardized exam. The APTD exam is a two-hour exam composed of 115 multiple-choice questions, 100 of which are scored.
Adhere to a Code of Ethics and re-certify every three (3) years through at least 40 points of continuing professional development.

fb635bea-01e6-4c5a-947a-2445c74b1ee0.description: Education providers who are pre-approved by the ATD Certification Institute (ATD CI) are authorized to provide continuing education programs that qualify for initial eligibility and recertification of the Certified Professional in Talent Development (CPTD) and Associate Professional in Talent Development (APTD) credentials. Pre-approved providers must offer high-quality programming that has been developed and delivered by subject matter experts.
fb635bea-01e6-4c5a-947a-2445c74b1ee0.name: ATD CI Preapproved Education Provider

badge_template_activities.title: Pre-approved programs must be related to talent development as defined by the research-backed Talent Development Capability Capability Model.

Education providers who are pre-approved by the ATD Certification Institute must be able to offer proof of attendance and completion to those who participate in their programming. Credits are awarded based on direct instructional time spent in the activity with one point equal to one hour of instruction.
